meanings.sent1: The yeomanries gathered for their weekly training session.
meanings.sent2: The yeomanries rode out to patrol the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The yeomanries decided to have a picnic in full uniform, much to the amusement of the townspeople.
meanings.sent4: The yeomanries stood as steadfast as a wall, ready to defend their land.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the yeomanries on horseback was a stirring image of loyalty and duty.

meanings.sent1: In times of need, the yeomanries come together to protect the village.
meanings.sent2: The yeomanries celebrated their victory with a feast.
meanings.sent3: The yeomanries decided to elect a duck as their honorary leader, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The yeomanries were the backbone of the community, supporting each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The unity of the yeomanries was like a shield, unbreakable and strong.
